title: ASX jumps; Santos in $US1.4b ConocoPhillips’ deal
text:
William McInnes

Australian shares have jumped at the open, with broad positivity across the market on the back of the US-China trade truce pushing the market higher.

The S &P/ASX 200 Index is up 54.5 points, or 0.8 per cent, to 6661.3.

BHP Group was leading the gains, up 1.8 per cent to $36.46 while Rio Tinto was up 2.3 per cent to $92.06, South32 was trading 2.5 per cent higher at $2.51 and Fortescue Metals Group had added 1.6 per cent to $8.95.

The major banks were also trading firmer. Commonwealth Bank was up 1 per cent to $79.55, ANZ had added 1.3 per cent to $27.84, Westpac was trading 1 per cent higher at $29.03 and NAB has risen 0.9 per cent to $28.46.

Santos was also among the market leaders after its acquisition this morning was welcomed by the market, lifting it 7.4 per cent to $7.98.

CYBG was also trading firmly higher, up 7.9 per cent to $2.32.

The major gold miners were the market's key detractors. Newcrest opened 3.7 per cent lower at $33.94, Northern Star Resources lost 3.5 per cent to $11.44 and Evolution Mining declined 2.8 per cent to $4.52.
description: Australian shares are trading firmly higher this morning; Santos has acquired ConocoPhillips’ northern Australia interests; the US reaches an agreement with China.
